Package pl.put.poznan.checker.logic

Class ScenarioLevelVisitor

java.lang.Object
pl.put.poznan.checker.logic.ScenarioLevelVisitor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Visitor
public class ScenarioLevelVisitor extends Object implements Visitor
Class Responsible for creating and returning a Scenario with the depth limited to that specified by the user. Meaning that all sub-scenarios will be truncated if they appear beyond a certain depth threshold. The class contains field referring to maximum level tolerated when truncating scenarios. It also contains fields responsible for holding the currently saved Scenario and an ArrayList of steps relating to the saved Scenario. The class implements a Visitor interface.

Example usage of the class to create a truncated scenario steps for some previously created Scenario class instance called my_scenario: 

 
 ScenarioLevelVisitor visitor = new ScenarioLevelVisitor();
 visitor.setMaxLevel(2);
 my_scenario.accept(visitor);
 Scenario result = visitor.getScenario;

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Scenario
    getScenario()
    Returns the new truncated Scenario after assigning to it the new, truncated steps
    void
    setMaxLevel(int maxLevel)
    Method allowing for manually setting the maximum expected depth for the truncated scenario.
    void
    visit(Scenario scenario)
    Method responsible for visiting a Scenario class instance, assigns to the private field scenario the values of the title, actors and systemActors of the given visited scenario.
    void
    visit(Step step)
    Method responsible for visiting the Step class instance, checks the current depth, compares it against specified maximum allowed depth and decides if it should assign the given step and its substeps based on that information.
